description: Lentigo Maligna Melanoma is a type of skin cancer that typically develops from pre-existing lentigo maligna, a type of melanoma in situ. It usually occurs in sun-exposed areas of the skin, such as the face, neck, and arms.
symptoms: Irregularly shaped or colored lesion on the skin
Changes in the size or color of a mole
Itching or bleeding of the affected area
